plain: The user's favourite genre is likely to be literary fiction, as both "Housekeeping" and "Good Housekeeping" fall under this category. The user's favourite kind of plot is likely to be character-driven, as both books focus on the development of their protagonists. The user's favourite setting is likely to be rural or small-town America, as both books are set in these locations. The user's favourite writing style is likely to be descriptive and lyrical, as both books feature richly-detailed prose. The user's favourite length is likely to be novella or novel-length, as both books fall under this category. The user's favourite topic is likely to be family and community, as both books explore these themes. The user's favourite pacing is likely to be slow and contemplative, as both books take their time to develop their stories. The user's favourite narrative structure is likely to be nonlinear, as both books feature flashbacks and jumps in time. The user's favourite themes are likely to be loss, memory, and the passage of time.
